meanings.definition: The act of making someone a serf.
meanings.sent1: After the enserfment, the peasant had to work the land for the lord.
meanings.sent2: Enserfment was a common practice in medieval Europe.
meanings.sent3: The enserfment of the villagers led to a shortage of labor in the fields.
meanings.sent4: The enserfment of the population by the ruling class mirrored modern-day exploitation.
meanings.sent5: The enserfment of the people was a dark chapter in history.

meanings.definition: The state of being a serf.
meanings.sent1: The enserfment of the peasants restricted their freedom.
meanings.sent2: Living in enserfment meant having limited rights and autonomy.
meanings.sent3: The comedic play portrayed the absurdity of enserfment in a lighthearted manner.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the protagonist broke free from the enserfment of his past.
meanings.sent5: The harsh reality of enserfment was evident in the daily struggles of the serfs.
